meanings.definition: Decapodans: a group of crustaceans with ten legs, including crabs and lobsters.
meanings.sent1: The decapodans scuttled along the ocean floor, searching for food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study decapodans to learn more about marine life.
meanings.sent3: The decapodans held a dance party under the sea, moving gracefully with their ten legs.
meanings.sent4: In the underwater kingdom, the decapodans ruled as the masters of the deep.
meanings.sent5: Children love to watch decapodans in aquariums, marveling at their unique appearance.

meanings.definition: Decapodans: relating to or characteristic of decapodans.
meanings.sent1: The decapodans habitat provided a perfect environment for the crustaceans.
meanings.sent2: The decapodans species displayed a wide range of colors and sizes.
meanings.sent3: The decapodans party was the most colorful event in the underwater world.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as agile and precise as a decapodans navigating the ocean currents.
meanings.sent5: The decapodans markings were so distinct that they could be spotted from afar.
